education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science

projects.name: QuickChat
description: Engineered a real-time chat application with an intuitive interface and seamless messaging experience.
Incorporated React for a dynamic interface and integrated Socket.io with Express for event-based messaging.
Established a MongoDB schema for user data and chat histories, ensuring easy retrieval of past conversations.
Integrated Auth0 for user authentication, guaranteeing secure access to chat histories and user data.

projects.name: RookieDB: B+ Tree Database Index
description: Constructed a comprehensive B+ tree indexing mechanism to facilitate faster search, insert, and delete operations on the RookieDB, a prototype database system.
Devised leaf and inner node structures, ensuring that leaf nodes contained pairs of keys and Record IDs, and inner nodes stored keys with pointers to child nodes.
Leveraged RecordId to identify and retrieve table records based on page numbers and entry numbers.
Implemented a bulk load method to optimally and efficiently load large amounts of data into the database.

projects.name: TileExplorer: 2D Open World Simulator
description: Built a 2D tile-based open-world simulation framework in Java, with the StdDraw library.
Developed a random world generation feature, resulting in unique and dynamic environments.
Enhanced user interaction by implementing customizable avatars and enabling movement through keyboard inputs.
Augmented user engagement with a robust saving/loading system. Persistently stored simulation attributes, including avatar characteristics and events, in a serialized CSV format.

projects.name: Ants vs. Bees
description: Designed a tower defense game where players deploy ants to protect their colony against bee invaders.

Employed advanced object-oriented programming concepts to create class hierarchies representing game states, ants with diverse abilities, bees with different strategies, and interconnected game environments.
Architected a dynamic game environment comprising the colony tunnel, hive, and home base with unique interactions that influenced gameplay strategies.
Diversified gameplay with 12 ant classes, designed with unique abilities, using inheritance and polymorphism.

leadershipAndWorkExperience.title: Chief Justice of Green River College
responsibilities: Directed the Judicial Board committee in managing the disciplinary process for ASGRC Senators and facilitating deliberations regarding the $16,000 club programming fund.
Assisted the Green River Technology Fee Committee with financial decisions regarding the campus tech needs.
Presented the developed yearly budget and proposed the student government constitutional changes within the student government to the Board of Trustees.
Advocated for Washington students and communicated student priorities to legislators on issues including mental health resources, textbook affordability, and food insecurity.

leadershipAndWorkExperience.title: Mathematics & Economics Tutor
responsibilities: Managed tutoring sessions for college-level Macroeconomics, Microeconomics, and Mathematics courses, including Calculus, Differential Equations, Linear Algebra, Statistics, and Discrete Mathematics, for up to 9 hours a week.
